definition: timid/to be afraid of getting involved/to be afraid of getting into trouble
surname Pa
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: He held them in contempt for behaving in such a cowardly way.
sentences.chinese: 他看不起他们，因为他们这样胆小怕事。

sentences.english: You should speak clearly to the men and the groups that timid.
sentences.chinese: 对“怕事”的人或组织要挑明了说。

sentences.english: No faint heart would be able to appeal to him to reverse our course.
sentences.chinese: 没有哪一个胆小怕事的人能说服他改变我们的方针。

sentences.english: He was no coward in spirit.
sentences.chinese: 精神上他倒并非胆小怕事。

sentences.english: Did you ever see a counterfeit of timidity, Mr. Lorry?
sentences.chinese: 你看见过假装胆小怕事的么，罗瑞先生？

sentences.english: She says that Sellers later chided her for being timid.
sentences.chinese: 她说塞勒斯后来斥责她胆小怕事。

sentences.english: He is a shy and withdrawing kind of person.
sentences.chinese: 他是个有点腼腆且怕事的人。

sentences.english: So cowardice is my main weapon of survival.
sentences.chinese: 所以胆小怕事是我生存的主要武器。

definition: cowardice/timid
to cause trouble
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
cowering/cringing
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
it is better to avoid unnecessary trouble (idiom)/the less complications the better
pinyin: duo1 yi1 shi4 bu4 ru2 shao3 yi1 shi4

definition: greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
to stir up trouble
fearing nothing in Heaven or Earth (idiom)/fearless
pinyin: tian1 bu4 pa4 di4 bu4 pa4

definition: to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
in the wrong
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
to meddle/to be a "nosy Parker"/to be too inquisitive about other people's business
to make public/to disclose
